result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Sears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay resitution in full plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.
No contact with victim or his residence. Not to use or possess any weapons.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2
Restitution summary

Defendant James D Sears in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant James D Sears in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Cts. 1 & 3 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make sentencing statement. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant James D Sears in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant James D Sears in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James D Sears in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant James D Sears in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelimim. Set for prelim. Bond remains in effect.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Defendant was fingeprinted 6/09/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 9/15/14)

No contact direct or indirect with G.H. or his residence at 112 S. 3rd Ave.   Not to possess or use any weapons including hunting knives. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant James D Sears appears by video conference along with attorney Eric S Maciolek, who appears by phone.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
